physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was alert and oriented. Speech was dysarthric. Pupils were 3 mm and equally reactive to light. Complete ptosis of the left eyelid observed. Limited upward gaze in both eyes. Weak eyelid closure bilaterally, weaker on the left. Decreased facial sensation to light touch in V2 distribution bilaterally. Mild left facial droop noted. Strength in all limbs was 5/5. Deep tendon reflexes were 2+ and symmetric. Sensation to light touch, pinprick, and temperature was intact on the right side but diminished in the left arm and leg. Truncal ataxia noted during sitting and walking with unsteady, wide-based gait.
The patient had recurrent headaches, generalized weakness, and a droopy left eyelid, alongside significant cranial nerve palsies and cognitive decline.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient's headache, cranial nerve palsies, sensory loss, and ataxia improved after starting treatment with amphotericin and flucytosine.
